shortdesc.i: This event is fired by the system. If you want to listen to the event you can do so using the document.addEventListener function and remove the listener using the document.removeEventListener function. The batterystatus event is triggered whenever the: battery level changes, device starts to receive a charge, device stops receiving a charge.

dd.p: The callback function that will be invoked on the batterystatus event.
An object with the pertinent information.
The percentage of the battery charge (0-100).
A boolean that represents whether or not the device is receiving a charge.

p.pre:
<script type="text/javascript">

function onBatteryStatusChange(info) {
    alert("The device " + info.isPlugged?"is ":"is not " + "plugged in with " + info.level + "% battery remaining");
}

document.addEventListener("batterystatus", onBatteryStatusChange);

</script>
